conclusion: Determine the electric field strength at (h, h, -h) due to induced charges.
A point charge +q is located at A(0, 0, h).
Region z ≤ 0 is filled with an infinite conductor.
Electric field inside the conductor is zero in electrostatic equilibrium.
Use the method of images to replace the conductor with an imaginary charge.
Place an image charge -q at (0, 0, -h) to ensure zero electric field inside the conductor.
Electric field due to a point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r^2.
Calculate distance from +q at (0, 0, h) to (h, h, -h): r1 = h√6.
Calculate distance from -q at (0, 0, -h) to (h, h, -h): r2 = h√2.
Electric field due to +q at (h, h, -h): E1 = kq/6h^2.
Electric field due to -q at (h, h, -h): E2 = -kq/2h^2.
Net electric field at (h, h, -h) is E1 + E2 = -kq/3h^2.
Magnitude of the electric field is |E_net| = kq/3h^2.
Final answer: Magnitude of electric field strength at (h, h, -h) is kq/3h^2.
